events.name: When VR and AR Collide: Which Technology Will Win the Reality Altering Race?
events.description:
Join key thought leaders, vendors and practitioners in the quickly evolving space of Virtual Reality and Augmented Reality to debate and experience the latest technology advances and projects. During the evening’s panel session, we’ll hear opinions from four of the industry's top practitioners on the future of these technologies: • Ariel Talbi, Founder and MD, Takanto Virtual Reality APAC • Chris Bell, Business Dir, Blippar • Maxime Depondt, Creative Director, EON Reality • Mithru Vigneshwara, Software Engineer, R/GA • Don Anderson, APAC Head of Kids & Learning Partnerships, YouTube (moderator) You’ll also get hands-on experience with some of the latest and greatest technologies and projects from our members, including VRCollab, Blippar, WoobaVR, Octagon and warrior9. The Evening Rundown5-6 pm - setup6 pm - VR and AR demos kickoff7 pm - panel session7:40 pm - Q&A8 pm - networking and more demos9:30 pm - end Our Panelists  Ariel Talbi, Founder and MD, Takanto Virtual Reality Ariel has 13 years of experience in leading global teams and developing channels and new markets for innovative technologies. Believing that immersive VR content will allow companies to take their creativity and Customer Experience to the next level, Ariel and Takanto are working on various VR productions with leading global brands, such as Flight Centre, Tourism Queensland, Issta Travel Group, Silk Air, Air Asia and more. Chris Bell, Business Director, APAC - Blippar  Chris has over 12 years of experience working with global brands embedding disruptive emerging technologies into the marketing mix.  Blippar is on a mission to index the world using machine learning Artificial Intelligence (AI), and believe that AI alongside Augmented Reality (AR) will be the big disruptors of the next 5 years. Chris will speak about how Blippar is using these and other technologies to build a new 'internet on things', from brands packaging, advertising to all other everyday objects.   Maxime Depondt, Creative Director, EON Reality After graduating in Visual Communication in France, Maxime worked as a producer supervising design projects for many renown TV stations such as MTV, Eurosport, Fox Kids and international Brands like Cartier, HP, Pernod Ricard, L'oreal, Levi's, Huawei, Armani, Nike. He has spent 8 years in Shanghai, China as Creative Producer collaborating with many international agencies on brand events and video productions. In 2013, he moved to Singapore and joined Eon Reality, where he has been continuously growing his passion for VR. Mithru Vigneshwara, Software Engineer, R/GA Singapore Mithru enjoys exploring the possible connections between technology and art. At R/GA, he develops experiences for global brands like Nike, Google and Samsung. As a practising new media artist and maker, Mithru frequently collaborates with the Media Lab at Lasalle and his own art collective ArtMakesUs. His work has been featured at events and in publications such as iLight Marina Bay, Siggraph Asia, The Creators Project, Creative Applications Network, and numerous occasions at the ArtScience Museum in Singapore. 

THIS IS A FREE EVENT In partnership with YouTube Kids & Learning and NUS Enterprise @ Blk71.  Let us know if you would like to subscribe to the NUS Enterprise Plug-In newsletter to receive updates about entrepreneur related events. For more information: http://www2.blk71.com/  About the AsiaVR AssociationThe AsiaVR Association is a non-profit association focused on promoting dialogue, debate, collaboration and investment in this rapidly evolving area of technology innovation. Our members come from a wide variety of disciplines, including user interface and application development through to VR documentary filmmaking and branded content creation. We welcome anyone interested in contributing to the discussion, or just wanting to come up to speed on this exciting new area, to join us. Join in our discussion in our Facebook Group. https://www.facebook.com/groups/asiavr/
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951
events.group_name: AsiaVR Association - Singapore Virtual Reality Meetup Group

events.name: PyData Meetup - June 2016 - Financial Big Data Initiatives + Kaggle
events.description: Agenda • 6:45pm - 7:00pm Networking • 7:00pm - 8:00pm Presentation: A Semantic Web of Information in the Financial Industry by Eric Tham Synopsis: The Web 3.0 evolution is the next step to make the Web more structured for information extraction. Presently, many information retrieval systems work through similarity measures or a generative statistical model. The Web 3.0 makes information retrieval more structured through a RDF format / triples relationship. Thomson Reuters has existing initiatives like the OpenCalais and the open source PermIDs to facilitate information retrieval. PermIDs are immutable 64bit identifiers on entities that are consistent across different domains. There are Python APIs for OpenCalais. Through triples relationships, entities are linked in a semantic web. Some applications in finance can be found in credit risk network, KYC, supply chain risks or portfolio risk management. Speaker: Eric Tham is presently an Enterprise Data Scientist with Thomson Reuters. He was previously in a startup in China doing NLP and sentiment analysis; He has presented and published papers in sentiment analysis and Energy Economics. He has spoken in Pycon APAC and will also be speaking in the forthcoming Strata and Hadoop conference. He has a Masters degree in Financial Engineering from Columbia University and a MSBA from NUS. • 8:00pm-8:15pm Lightning Talk: Pair Data Science - Learning machine learning from past Kaggle competitions by Chen Zhenhao Synopsis: Zhenhao will be sharing his learning journey in machine learning with Amazon's Employee Access Challenge dataset on Kaggle. Speaker: Zhenhao is an application analyst at DHL Express. He started learning machine learning after attending Andrew Ng's machine learning online course last year. It is now his main obsession during his free time. Updates • PyCon Singapore 2016 is happening on June 23-25. See https://pycon.sg/ • New ebooks/videos from O'Reilly! Only for members (who have not requested for ebooks) attending the session! • Join the NSCC (National Supercomputing Centre Singapore) Hackathon! Solve interesting business problems with supercomputers http://www.nscchackathon.com/ Join us on Facebook and Twitter  https://www.facebook.com/groups/pydatasg/ https://www.twitter.com/pydatasg  Sponsors     Group Sponsor
events.location: Skyscanner, 39 Robinson Road, #09-01 Robinson Point, Singapore 068911

events.name: Getting Started with 360 Video and Virtual Reality
events.description:
No one could have guessed what was on Mark Zuckerberg's mind when Facebook acquired Oculus for $2 billion back in 2014. Not until a year later, when 360 videos became a news feed feature on Facebook's wall, Google Cardboards shipped over 5 million; and Virtual Reality became a buzz word across industries and investors.

Just what is the hype behind 360 and Virtual Reality? More importantly - can you be part of it? How technical is the progress and what does it entail?

In this hour-long session, VR Technologist Lionel Chok will attempt to answer some of the above, demo some of his works, as well as how to get you started in the live action 360 and VR space, plus also differentiate those in CG, Animation and Gaming.

There will also be a Q&A session after the talk.

Register Here
https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/creative-crew-talks-june-meeting-2016-tickets-25767717938
events.location: Toa Payoh Public Library, 6 Toa Payoh Central, Singapore 319191

events.name: Ansible Singapore kickoff meeting
events.description: For our Ansible Singapore kickoff meetup, we are pleased to have Dylan Silva, Ansible Product Manager at Redhat and evangelist, as our main speaker, giving us an intro to Ansible, future, deep dive and demo. Kingsley Wood of Redhat will also do a short presentation and overview of general management in the cloud. Special thanks to Redhat for providing refreshments and the venue.

events.name: Book Club: From NAND to Tetris – Assembler
events.description: Read The Elements of of Computing Systems and/or follow the Coursera course Build a Modern Computer from First Principles: From Nand to Tetris.   "I did the coursework because understanding computers is important to me, just like literacy and numeracy, and I made it through. I never worked harder on anything, never been challenged to this degree. But given what I now feel capable of doing, I would certainly do it again. To anyone considering NAND2Tetris, it's a tough journey, but you'll be profoundly changed." Shimon Schocken, the author of the book talks about the course at TED: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iE7YRHxwoDs How Book Club Works1. Read the chapter before you come to the meetup.2. Find something in the chapter you found interesting and maybe research it a little more.3. At the meetup, we go around the room and each person gets a chance to tell the group about the thing they found interesting.4. Group discussion and banter ensues! Book club is held at Tim & Wei's residence: 244A Tanjong Katong RdSingapore 437032Singapore Doors open at 6:30, meetup starts at 7. Bring snacks and drinks of your choice!  Feel free to ask questions in the SingaporeJS gitter room: https://gitter.im/SingaporeJS/discussions Useful Links • NAND to Tetris website: http://www.nand2tetris.org/• Get the book: http://www.amazon.com/Elements-Computing-Systems-Building-Principles/dp/0262640686/• Coursera course: https://www.coursera.org/learn/build-a-computer/
events.location: Tim & Wei's Residence, 244A Tanjong Katong Road, Singapore

events.name: Student Investing in Singapore | Free Investment Workshop | Young Investor
events.description:
What are you doing to start investing?  
Even though most people would agree on the importance of investing, the #1 REASON why they procrastinate when it comes to STARTING is because they are not able to filter and process the endless amount of information, sometimes irrelevant information. There is little or no guidance. 
  
Most beginners don’t know that there is in fact, a simple way to start investing. 
  
Read on to find out how an ordinary undergraduate and café barista had managed to JUMPSTART his investing empire with just $500 capital, in this letter below: 
   
"Dear Students,   
I would like to take to share with you my story. Hopefully, it will inspire you in one way or another. I am from Malaysia. At the age of 12 years old, I came to Singapore with scholarship for a better education. Even though I was young, it wasn't exactly a tough decision for my family and I. Having a scholarship to fund my tuition fees, accommodation and living expenses means we have less to worry about.   
But things took a turn for the worse - After my "A" Levels result missed the expected grade, I did not qualify for a continuation of the scholarship. Nonetheless, I was eager to enter into a Singapore local university, even though it was costly. So my family and I took out a hefty bank loan and I started my tertiary education in NUS.   
Throughout my undergraduate studies in NUS, I was very wary of my expenses. With the regular appreciation of the Singapore Dollar against the Malaysia Ringgit, I had to work hard as a Barista in a café to fund myself. My course mates often tease me for my constant state of frustration. On top of that, I had to fulfil my duty with hall activities, in order to qualify for a spot in hall for cheap accommodation!  
I barely managed my first year in NUS. Balancing all these different aspects had taken a toll on me as an undergraduate. Finally I couldn’t take it anymore. I decided to halt all my involvement in hall activities, took a break from studies, and stop socialising all together. I considered dropping out. I was tired. I was desperate.  
One day I had enough, and I took a leap of faith.  
I started SOCIAL TRADING. I not only invested into the forex market, I invested into the idea of setting aside a small capital to COPY top traders in order to profit. This simple concept and technology was AMAZING. It was exactly what I was looking for. I opened a $500 account and immediately started following and copying top traders on a social trading platform. It was surprisingly easy.  
I was pleasantly SHOCKED when months later, I found that my ROI of $500 was over 250%! But not without taking calculated risk and taking small losses. At the end of the day, I realized that investing and trading CAN be very profitable!  
Social trading hence started a burning desire in me to learn more, and to improve myself. I started my education on investing and trading and I never looked back since. Today I am very happy to say that I am now a full time forex trader and investor.   
Students or young executives, if you can relate to what I shared and you would like to do something about your situation, I want YOU to remember this 3 takeaways:   
1.   STOP being a financial burden. Start thinking about how you can be FINANCIALLY INDEPENDENT, and even contribute to your family. It isn’t easy, but all actions starts with a thought.  
2.   START LIVING. Steve Jobs put it well: your time is limited. Don’t waste it on living somebody else’s life. Don’t let the noise of other people’s opinions drown your own voice. Have the courage to follow your heart and intuition. Somehow, they already know what you truly want to become.  
 3.   FOCUS on ONE thing.  You don’t have to be good at everything. Look at the successful people around you. All of them simply have to master one thing and be the expert of one thing, and build their success around just one thing. Yes, just ONE! For me, it was looking for the right Master Trader to copy. Eventually, I became a Master Trader myself. 
Thank you for reading – Kar Yong" 
A self-taught trader, Kar Yong was interviewed in Channel Newsasia’s Money Mind Young Investor in 2013. In the same year, he was also featured as Social Guru on eToro social trading platform, where he led the way in a bustling global trading market and guided more than 1000 traders with a developed strategy and perspective of market conditions through discussions and blogs.He founded FX Pipsology in 2014, a platform dedicated to people with similar interest in forex trading. His desire to share and connect with people has since influenced many aspiring traders. He is now an internationally sought-after trainer, receiving mentorship requests from traders all over the world. Connect with Kar Yong on Facebook here. 
 
 
                                                                                                                        
Join Kar Yong and his team in this action packed, FREE 2 hour workshop and find out more on how you can too, change your life for the better.  
  
Who should attend:  
1.   A beginner who is having a hard time making profits in investments  
2.   Thinking about starting an investment portfolio, or trade forex.  
3.   Have been trading for a while but still haven't found that profitable strategy.   
4.   Looking for source of alternative side income but not confident in investing alone.  
  
Meet Kar Yong in this FREE exclusive meeting, where he will help you:           
1.   Find out how you can start investing with a low start-up capital and 10x your income potential. 
2.   Uncover how you can make money work for you rather than you working for money by leveraging on this one SIMPLE concept. 
3.   Discover this 8th wonder of the world that will make you a Millionaire used by Warren Buffett - one of the richest investors in the world. 
4.   Empower yourself with this most crucial skill that formal education is not teaching you but is one of the most valuable skillsets that will make you rich  
 
Build your investment foundation by joining us in this Young Millionaire Investor Community where we will walk this journey and grow as a YOUNG INVESTOR WITH YOU! 
  
  
EVENT DETAILS:

DO NOTE THIS EVENT REGISTRATION STARTS 30 MINS EARLIER, this is an invitation ONLY for those who are committed.
